title: 103_hr3694
content: The "Child Abuse Accountability Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes garnishment authority. The Civil Service Retirement System allows payments to be made to another person based on court decrees of divorce, annulment, legal separation, or garnishment for child abuse enforcement. The Office will prioritize multiple legal processes for moneys due to individuals on a first-come, first-served basis. Amendments are made to sections of the United States Code regarding court definitions and judgments for specific cases. Amendments are made to the United States Code regarding court definitions and judgments for cases involving physical, sexual, or emotional abuse of a child under 18 years of age. Payments under the Federal Employees' Retirement System may be redirected to another person under certain circumstances. The Federal Employees' Retirement System allows payments to be redirected to another person under specific circumstances outlined in court decrees, orders, or legal processes related to divorce, annulment, legal separation, or enforcement of judgments for child abuse. If multiple legal processes are served for the same payments, they will be satisfied on a first-come, first-served basis. Section 8467 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to define terms related to judgments for child abuse, ensuring priority for satisfaction of legal processes for payment redirection under the Federal Employees' Retirement System. The term 'child' is defined as an individual under 18 years of age. Section 8437(e)(3) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include enforcement of a judgment for physically, sexually, or emotionally abusing a child. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on the date of enactment and will apply to any legal process received by the Office of Personnel Management or the Executive Director of the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board after that date.
